Event.0: "Bloody Friday" saw many of the world's stock exchanges experienced the worst declines in their history, with drops of around 10% in most indices.
Event.1: African American civil rights activist Rosa Parks—whose refusal to relinquish her seat on a public bus to a white man in 1955 helped ignite the American civil rights movement—died in Detroit.
Event.2: Supersonic passenger service ended as British Airways flew its last Concorde flight; Air France had ceased similar operations in May.
Event.4:
Wayne Rooney
British football player
was born
Event.5: Guinness Book of Records presents Paul McCartney with a rhodium disc as all-time best selling singer-songwriter
Event.6: Salvador Allende's election as the first Marxist president of Chile was confirmed.
Event.7: "Love Story" actress Ali MacGraw (30) weds film producer Robert Evans (39)
Event.8: "The Manchurian Candidate", directed by John Frankenheimer, starring Frank Sinatra and Laurence Harvey, is released
Event.9: Cuban missile crisis: Soviet ships approach but stop short of the US blockade of Cuba
Event.10: "The Manchurian Candidate", directed by John Frankenheimer, starring Frank Sinatra and Laurence Harvey, is released
Event.11: Singer Bing Cosby marries second wife actress Kathryn Grant
Event.12:
Malcolm Turnbull
prime minister of Australia
was born
Event.13:
United Nations established
The charter for the United Nations—the world's premier international organization, established at the end of World War II to maintain world peace and friendly relations among nations—entered into force this day in 1945.
Event.14: The 40-hour workweek went into effect under the U.S. Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938.
Event.15: A record 12,894,650 shares of stock were traded, causing the first day of real panic in the Crash of 1929, known as “Black Thursday.”
Event.16: "Black Thursday", start of stock market crash, Dow Jones down 12.8%
Event.17: Benito Mussolini summoned a “March on Rome” and subsequently became dictator of Italy.
Event.18: More than 600,000 Italians surrendered or retreated at the Battle of Caporetto during World War I.
Event.19: US Admiral George Dewey (29) weds daughter of New Hampshire's war governor Susan Goodwin
Event.20: The first transcontinental telegram was sent via the telegraph in the United States, effectively bringing to an end the Pony Express.
Event.21: World's first soccer club, Sheffield F C, founded in Yorkshire, England
Event.22:
Bahādur Shāh II
Mughal emperor
was born
Event.23: Treaty of Westphalia ends The Thirty Year's War in the Holy Roman Empire; Switzerland's independence recognized
Event.24: The Peace of Westphalia ended the Eighty Years' War between Spain and the Dutch and the German phase of the Thirty Years' War.
Event.25:
Antonie van Leeuwenhoek
Dutch scientist
was born
Event.26: Dutch microscopist Antonie van Leeuwenhoek, who became the first to observe bacteria and protozoans, was born.
Event.27: Qutuz, Mamluk Sultans of Egypt (1259-60), is assassinated by Baibars, a fellow Mamluk leader, who seizes power for himself
